The relationship between exchangeable Ca measurements in the Oa horizon (
), made in 1997-2000 (original analysis) and measurements of the archived samples reanalyzed in 2013-2014 (reanalysis). The
1:1 line is shown on the plot. The equation represents the best-fit line determined by linear regression.

A significant difference (P <0.10) was obtained between the original analysis (mean = 0.40 cmol
although linear regression showed a highly significant linear relationship between the two data sets (P <0.001; R

A change in the SOP for determining exchangeable Al concentrations resulted in differing results between the original analysis in which Al was
and the reanalysis in which Al was measured by inductively coupled plasma (ICP) following Blume
of exchangeable Al measurements of 15 Oa horizon samples (
/kg) revealed a strong linear relationship (P <0.001; R
= 0.96) and significant bias (P <0.05). As was done for B horizon Ca
concentrations, the regression model was used to adjust the original values of the 40 samples not reanalyzed to remove analytical bias.
